intro: Lagoseris alata, commonly known as the winged sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the yellow-orange flower head, which consists of numerous small florets arranged in a radiate pattern. Lagoseris alata is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
